There's an instructional guide explaining character stats and how to increase them. Read a tutorial?
Every character has five main stats for @Heart HEALTH, @Axe POWER @Gun TECH, @Staff MANA, and @Shield GRIT. High stats are what your characters need to be successful in combat.
@Heart HEALTH is the number of hit points a character has. When a character reaches 0 hit points they cannot act in combat. Hit points are automatically restored after combat.
@Axe POWER determines the power and accuracy of attacks made with physical, brute force weapons like axes and swords.
@Gun TECH determines the power and accuracy of attacks made with high tech weapons and devices like guns and robot parts.
@Staff MANA is magical affinity. It increases the strength of spells and magic items while shielding against incoming magic damage. Drones have no magical affinity.
@Shield GRIT reduces incoming damage from non-magical sources. Wearing armor is a good way to increase @Shield GRIT.
The highest of @Axe @Gun and @Staff are used to determine initial iniative order in combat. The highest of @Axe @Gun and @Shield are also used to determine evade rate against non-magical attacks.
Mechanical characters like androids and drones can increase their stats by equipping weapons and armor. Find better items to get bigger stat gains!
Humans and androids can randomly increase their stats permanently after combat depending on actions taken in combat. Characters excerise stats by using relevant items and abilities.
Some characters increase their stats faster than others. Characters only get a chance to increase their stats if they finish combat with 1 or more hit points.
